Package it.polimi.ingsw.server.model

Class KillShotTrack

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.ingsw.server.model.KillShotTrack
  • public class KillShotTrack
extends java.lang.Object
    Is the part of board that keeps track of kills and remaining skulls. It embeds part of the logic for final point calculation.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private int biggerScore
      A constant used to determine the points to give to each player
      private java.util.Map<Player,​java.lang.Integer> killingCounter
      A support map used to keep track of the killings of each player
      private java.util.List<Player> killingOrder
      A list to keep track of the order of killing
      private int skulls
      keeps the number of skulls currently remaining in the match
      private java.util.List<java.util.Map<Player,​java.lang.Integer>> track
      The actual killshot track, each slot is a tuple (Player, number_of_drops)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      KillShotTrack​(int skulls)
      Constructs a killshot track with the specified number of initial skulls.

    • Method Detail

      • getKillingOrder

        public int getKillingOrder​(Player p)
        Returns the ordinal position of killing of hte specified player
        Parameters:
        p - the player involved
        Returns:
        An integer representing the ordinal position. 0 is the first.

      • getKillingOf

        public int getKillingOf​(Player p)
        Returns the number of drops of the specified player on the killshot track If a player overkills someone, it is counted twice
        Parameters:
        p - the player involved
        Returns:
        An integer representing the number of drops on the killshot track

      • getSkulls

        public int getSkulls()

      • addKilled

        public void addKilled​(java.util.Map<Player,​java.lang.Integer> killed)
        Adds the drops corresponding to killing (eventually with overkill) to the killshot track. Support variables are updated, too.
        Parameters:
        killed - A tuple (player, number_of_drops_to_add)

      • score

        public java.util.Map<Player,​java.lang.Integer> score()
        Returns the number of points to add to each player. Only players who killed at least once are in the map
        Returns:
        a map (player, points_to_add_to_the_player)

      • getGreatestKillerIn

        private Player getGreatestKillerIn​(java.util.Map<Player,​java.lang.Integer> killers)
        A support method used to get the greatest killer (counting overkills) in a certain list of players
        Parameters:
        killers - The list of players to analyze
        Returns:
        the player who has killed most in the list

      • nextScore

        private int nextScore​(int currentScore)
        Support method used to get the succession of points to add to the players
        Parameters:
        currentScore - Points given to the last player scored
        Returns:
        Points to give to the next player to be scored
